name: XFusion
short_description:
XFusion is a portable (but only across Linux distributions) multimedia library designed to provide convenient API to access keyboard, mouse, video, 3D acceleration, sound and video decoding via GStreamer. XFusion also provides an easy API to show informational dialog boxes to the user (currently supported toolkit: GTK3 - future releases will have support for QT).

XFusion uses OpenAL for sound, OpenGL for graphics, XInput2 for user input, Xlib for window management, pthreads for threading and many more. XFPanel (XFusion Administration Panel) is included - allows for simple testing of users PC.

The goal is to create a API and ABI stable environment for developers. Currently project is in early planning, although some code has already been written.
summary: A graphical library implementing input, 3d graphics, sound and video
